author: Kirsten Korosec
title: Stocks post worst quarter since 2008 financial crisis
description: The first quarter of 2020 ended with a whimper — with the Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500 and NASDAQ posting their worst quarter in decades — as the COVID-19 pandemic continues to cause uncertainty and volatility across all major stock market indices. A…
content: The first quarter of 2020 ended with a whimper  with the Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500 and NASDAQ posting their worst quarter in decades as the COVID-19 pandemic continues to cause uncertainty and volatility across all major stock market indices.…

author: Catherine Shu
title: Grab hires Peter Oey as its chief financial officer

content:
Grab announced today that it has hired Peter Oey as its new chief financial officer. Prior to joining Grab, Oey was the chief financial officer at LegalZoom, an online legal services company based near Los Angeles.

title: DoorDash will offer financial assistance to delivery workers diagnosed with COVID-19 or quarantined

author: Jonathan Shieber
title: Financial markets may be sliding globally, but interest in stock trading apps soars

author: Manish Singh
title: Setu raises $15M to help developers connect with banks to offer Indians ‘sachet-sized’ financial products

title: Financial expert: If you're laid off, ask this question first
description: Financial expert Ted Jenkin reveals which questions you should ask in the event you are laid off from your job due to the coronavirus pandemic.
content: Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds.

author: Andrew J. Hawkins
title: Uber wants Congress to include protections for drivers in coronavirus stimulus package
description: Uber is urging elected leaders in Washington, DC to include financial protections for drivers and delivery workers. It is also calling for legal fixes to allow it to continue to classify drivers as independent contractors while also providing some benefits.
content: Photo by Jakub Porzycki/NurPhoto via Getty Images Uber is urging the White House and congressional leaders to include financial assistance for drivers and delivery workers in the economic stimulus package that is currently under debate. The company is also ad…

author: Jon Fingas
title: Apple Card holders can defer April payments, too
description: Apple Card holders are getting another reprieve in light of the COVID-19 pandemic's economic impact. Apple is emailing customers to let them know that they can defer their April payments without interest if if the outbreak has made it difficult to pay on time…
content: The offer is in line with efforts by banks and other financial institutions to address the sudden surge of people who are out of work or otherwise taking a monetary hit due to the pandemic. Apple, Goldman Sachs and others are still expecting customers to pay …

title: After Tokyo 2020 postponement, money has become a real worry for Olympian Gwen Berry

author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews
title: Global economy will suffer for 'years to come' says OECD
description: OECD boss Angel Gurría says the economic shock is already bigger than the financial crisis
content:
Image copyrightGetty Images

The world will take years to recover from the coronavirus pandemic, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has warned.

Angel Gurría, OECD secretary general, said the economic shock was already bigger than the …

title: Alan Shearer: ‘Let Premier League players decide the best way to help’
description: Premier League players will want to play their part in the fight against the financial effects of coronavirus, says Alan Shearer.
content:
English football has been suspended indefinitely because of the coronavirus outbreak

Not many Premier League players will need to be told to play their part in the fight against the financial effects of coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Manchester United's Paul Pogba sets up fundraiser and pledges financial support
description: Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba sets up a fundraising page and pledges financial support to Unicef to help children affected by coronavirus.
content:
Paul Pogba has set up a fundraiser to "help fight this war against Covid-19"

Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba has set up a fundraising page and pledged financial support to Unicef to help children affected by coronavirus.
